publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-201# Christine Grahame: Borders Rail Link—That the Parliament recognising the economic crisis in the Borders and appreciating the necessity for good transport lines as crucial to the social and economic advancement of the area, gives its support to the campaign for the restoration of a Borders rail link. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Ms Sandra White*, Michael Russell*, Robin Harper* R
S1M-201# Borders Rail Link (lodged on 11 October 1999) Dr Winnie Ewing*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Nicola Sturgeon*
S1M-201# Borders Rail Link (lodged on 11 October 1999) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-201# Borders Rail Link (lodged on 11 October 1999) David Mundell*, Brian Adam*

S1M-201# Christine Grahame: Borders Rail Link—That the Parliament recognising the economic crisis in the Borders and appreciating the necessity for good transport lines as crucial to the social and economic advancement of the area, gives its support to the campaign for the restoration of a Borders rail link. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Robin HarperR, Dr Winnie Ewing, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Nicola Sturgeon, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Lloyd Quinan, David Mundell, Brian Adam
S1M-201# Borders Rail Link (lodged on 11 October 1999) Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-201# Borders Rail Link (lodged on 11 October 1999) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-201# Borders Rail Link (lodged on 11 October 1999) Alex Fergusson*, Dennis Canavan*
S1M-201# Borders Rail Link (lodged on 11 October 1999) Linda Fabiani*, Alex Neil*, Alasdair Morgan*
